summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 4, 2021. The interview is part of the OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances. The witness discusses their role, the transfer of Epstein's cellmate Efrain Reyes, and general knowledge about events at the MCC in July and August 2019.

persons.name: Marcella Conley
persons.context: Identified as the transcriber of the interview in the certificate at the end of the document.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate at the MCC whose death is the subject of the OIG investigation. The interview discusses the circumstances of his death and the removal of his cellmate.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Inmate who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate. The interview focuses on his transfer from the MCC on August 9, 2019, and whether staff knew he was not returning.

persons.name: Sampson Choo
persons.context: Sent an email on August 8, 2019, regarding the transfer of prisoners, including Efrain Reyes, from MCC to Geo.

persons.name: Jayvon Busey
persons.context: Another inmate listed for transfer from MCC to Geo on the same email as Efrain Reyes.

persons.name: I.M. Fernandez
persons.context: An inmate mentioned in the daily lieutenant log as being placed on 'dry cell with staff watching' in R&D on August 9, 2019. The witness has no knowledge of this.

persons.name: Officer Thomas
persons.context: A correctional officer who was in the SHU when Epstein died. The witness was asked to conduct wellness checks on him in August 2019 but never made contact.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer who was in the SHU when Epstein died. The witness was asked to conduct wellness checks on him in August 2019 but never made contact.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the SHU at the MCC. His transfer on August 9, 2019, left Epstein without a cellmate.
Both were correctional officers assigned to the SHU at the time of Epstein's death and were subjects of wellness checks.

events.title: Transfer of Efrain Reyes
events.description: Efrain Reyes, Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate, was transferred from the MCC to a Geo facility. Emails from the U.S. Marshals Service on August 8 indicated the transfer. The daily log shows he was 'pre-removed' at 8:38 a.m.

events.title: I.M. Fernandez placed in dry cell in R&D
events.description: The daily lieutenant log indicates inmate I.M. Fernandez was placed on 'dry cell with staff watching' in the R&D area at 3:15 p.m. The witness states this is unusual and not standard procedure.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC, an apparent suicide by hanging. The witness was called in for overtime that day but learned no specific details at the time.

events.title: Epstein's alleged first suicide attempt
events.description: The witness states they learned after Epstein's death that he had allegedly attempted suicide on this date.

events.title: OIG Interview
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with a BOP Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist at the MCC as part of its investigation into Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
28632 Roadside Drive, Suite 285, Agoura Hills, CA 91301 (Resolute Documentation Services)
Geo (referenced as a contract facility for federal inmates)
keyFacts: The witness, a BOP supervisor in Receiving and Discharge (R&D), states they had no direct interaction with Jeffrey Epstein and did not know he was required to have a cellmate.

Documentation shows Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was transferred (WAB - With All Belongings) on August 9, 2019, not taken to court. The witness clarifies that 'WAB' means an inmate is not returning.
The witness indicates that internal court rosters/daily assignment sheets are printed and discarded daily, not retained, making it difficult to verify what was listed next to Reyes's name.
The witness heard rumors about staff not conducting rounds/counts and falsifying logs on August 9-10, 2019, but has no firsthand knowledge.
When asked what could have prevented Epstein's death, the witness cited a need for more training for staff, particularly on how to work in the SHU.
